Cool - I'll push a PR in the few next days.
There's an open PR somewhere around tagging
Merged another PR bumping FAB to 2.1.4

There are a couple of other docker issues that need to be addressed related to the Flask AppBuilder CLI update. But, there's not much to do to create a PR that makes the docker instructions actually functional: 

* adding gevent 1.4.0 to the requirements.txt file
* adding a root:root user to the superset service in `docker-compose.yml`
* correcting the bash instructions for initializing the examples
* adding the `FLASK_APP` env variable to `docker-init.sh` and removing the `--app` argument from  the `flask fab` command. 
* looks like the instructions in `CONTRIBUTING.md` also have the `--app` argument as well.

More than happy to put up a PR to fix those issues.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions. For admin, please label this issue `.pinned` to prevent stale bot from closing the issue.

I tried to repro this in master, but didn't have any luck. Were you making a sync or an async query here?

The only way I can see us getting into this state on the frontend is if the `changed_on` field for a query was None. I'm not really sure if that's possible, if I can figure out how to repro this then I'll dig in further
Reopen
Thanks for the help; fairly sure this was sync. I'll look closer at what's happening next time I have the chance and report back.

I agree the use case is pretty specific and in general I tried to make the PR as configurable as possible for a feature like this. I could see many other companies wanting to configure their own data policy and display the modal for their internal users too, but I wonder if there's a use case for an even more generic "display a modal on load" feature. Perhaps to implement a new user experience?

That said, I'm a bit hesitant to add a fairly large, generic feature like that without a clear understanding of the more general use case. Maybe other contributors can comment if the feature as it stands today is useful for them?

I thought about the tradeoffs of padding the tab-pane a little, and though maybe we wanted more density like for data tables/previews. Then I thought that we don't want left or right margins for the layout to align.

I can to the conclusion that it's for the children to decide how they want to use the space.

I'm no designer and don't know much about structuring CSS properly. Happy to take a different approach.
That makes sense to me, thanks for the context!

Based on this [issue](https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/issues/2205), I believe the correct package is [cyrus-sasl-devel](https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/cyrus-sasl-devel)
Also, I think it would make more sense to label this issue with the documentation label not the bug label but I don't think I have permission.

Hi Brylie,

This may be of interest to you:
https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/5915
Francis

@villebro I find Wikipedia is normally a good source for name definitions. For example Apache Druid is called [Apache Druid](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apache_Druid) where's Google's BigQuery is simply called [BigQuery](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BigQuery).
@mistercrunch @villebro I've updated the documentation based on your suggestions.
@agrawaldevesh are you onboard with this change?

Go for it ! I only introduced the flag since I did not want to break
existing use cases. I have no issues with making this be default

I think they encountered some License problem, they are asking for volunteering, see [this thread](https://lists.apache.org/thread.html/5ca9bef3454dfb14b0328b0303109e6bf9747c5d2c688b42939ff169@%3Cdev.superset.apache.org%3E) in  the @dev list.

>From: Alan Gates
...
Running the above on the modules in setup.py, I see that the vast majority
are BSD, MIT, Apache, or PSFL, all of which are fine. The ones that aren't
in that category are:
certifi MPL-2.0: This is ok, as it's binary
chardet LGPL Not Ok
click UNKNOWN
jsonschema UNKNOWN
python-dateutil Dual License
python-dotenv UNKNOWN
python-geohash UNKNOWN
python3-openid UNKNOWN

>The MPL one is fine since it's included in binary form. The unknown and
dual license need some digging to determine what they are. chardet, the
LGPL one, is not ok.
...

>From: Maxime Beauchemin
@community, it'd be great if someone could volunteer to do this (making
the python library "requests" an optional dependency). It appears it's used
in its simplest form in a few places (requests.get) which should be easy to
replace with urrlib2. The Druid connector uses a more advanced feature
(basic auth), but that could be made just an optional dependency, as we're
deprecating the Druid connector, to be replaced by the SQLAlchemy Druid
connector/dialect. There it's just a matter of moving `pydruid` and
`requests` to the "extra_requires" section of our setup.py, and doing late
imports.
...

I think your should update acorn
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26794095/59282063-f7047100-8c70-11e9-9f22-92d776bc4191.png)
Thanks for the assistance @1AB9502!
Issue Label Bot is not confident enough to auto-label this issue. See [dashboard](https://mlbot.net/data/apache/incubator-superset) for more details.
@betodealmeida @xtinec @DiggidyDave any comments/thoughts here? It would be awesome to get some cross community feedback since this is a rather specific feature. Thanks!
@etr2460 have you considered making this more granular? Configurable per database or per data source?

Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label `#enhancement` to this issue, with a confidence of 0.94. Please mark this comment with :thumbsup: or :thumbsdown: to give our bot feedback! 

 Links: [app homepage](https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot), [dashboard](https://mlbot.net/data/apache/incubator-superset) and [code](https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp) for this bot.
bump

@betodealmeida the intention was to provide guidelines for using the entire tool as opposed to only specific databases/data sources. I'm not sure how configuring per data source would work for dashboards that could pull from multiple different data sources

(sorry left an early thought that was no longer relevant to my comment :-), now removed)

I like the idea of an interface that has a method for `authUserForGeneralAccess(user)` (and later can add `authUserForDatasource(user, datasource)`), returning a result that provides a method to get the dialog content if one should be shown. And there should probably be one other mechanism to feed dialog result back to the interface for a final "result" (allow, forbid, whatever). 

That leaves the impl to the discretion of the implementor/org.  I can imagine that we at Lyft might have a whole separate service dedicated to these things, and our implementation of such an interface would just delegate to that service and either a) let them access things without interruption, or b) forbid them, with a link to request access to a datasource, or c) allow them, but make them check a box first.

The backend storage needn't be coupled to the superset database, that feels heavy to me and too tightly coupled to this particular implementation.
The issue you're solving might be fixed by my PR here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/7690. If you pull that branch, do you still see the degraded performance?

Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label `#enhancement` to this issue, with a confidence of 0.63. Please mark this comment with :thumbsup: or :thumbsdown: to give our bot feedback!

@etr2460 that's awesome! I'll take a look.

I have a feeling that we might still need both solutions combined, since this one didn't solve all the performance problems. And our table when rendered has more than 2 millions pixels of width, so your solution might not be enough.

under the dir incubator-superset/contrib/docker, follow these:

Hi @syazwan0913,

Hi @tooptoop4,

Connection information is managed on "Sources" -> "Databases", and this meta information is kept on Superset's DB. So you must setup your DB outside of your EC2 instances

Hi @vibeesh,

My bad, submitted a PR to fix it. Can you please change `docker-init.sh` by correcting `flask fab create-admin --app superset` to `flask fab create-admin`

Yes, the filters on Views are applied to the view class only, and distinct for each related field. This enables a higher degree of configuration.

We can think of something that could be applied everywhere and probably `Model` is the best place, yet SQLAInterface is the one responsible for interfacing DB operations, so it would have to check for filters and apply them behind the scenes

> @etr2460 I'm doing some tests trying to optimize `getTextDimension` to avoid modifying the DOM, reusing the nodes instead of creating them from scratch all the time.

That should definitely help performance too! I think separate of the performance question, we should consider if monospace is the right direction to go for the query results. For some types of data, I think it's actually easier to read in monospace, but it probably depends on people's preference

The problem was that the cluster_name was not set in the DBtable clusters and  DBTable datasources.
Tried to reproduce the cluster creation steps, and got some strange results while trying to add or edit clusters. 
cluster name is an input, but is not mandatory. After saving the provided name is not used. After deletion, and creating a new cluster, the old clustername is used.
+1 for this one ;)
